Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasketballGame, FootballGame, HockeyGame, SoccerGame
abstract class Game extends Object
The Game class is an abstract base class representing a general sports game. It provides common attributes and methods for handling game state, teams, scores, and period management. Specific sports games will extend this class and implement sport-specific behaviors.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(String teamOne, String teamTwo)
      Default constructor that initializes a new game with the game status as "off" and initial scores set to zero for both teams. Team names are also initialized to empty strings.
      Parameters:
      teamOne - Name for Team One
      teamTwo - Name for Team Two

  • Method Details

    • addScore

      public abstract void addScore(int choice, int team)
      Adds score to selected team
      Parameters:
      choice - Scoring Method Choice
      team - What team was Chosen

    • incrementPeriod

      public abstract int incrementPeriod()
      Method used to increment period for each game
      Returns:
      Returns current period as Int, If game has ended will return -1

      Returns:

      public abstract int decrementTimePeriod()
      Increment Length of period Randomly after an Event has been chosen
      Returns:
      new Length of Period / Quarter / Half

    • getLengthofPeriodOfPlay

      public abstract int getLengthofPeriodOfPlay()
      Gets the remaining length of current period Returns length in minutes, set by subclass
      Returns:

    • getScoringMethods

      public abstract List<ScoringMethod> getScoringMethods()
      Holds String Value of Scoring Method Name and an Int corresponding to how many points should be added.
      Returns:
      ScoringMethods for each Game Subclass
